content.title: Dr. Ambedkar Medhavi Chattar Sansodhit Yojna
content.department: Ministry of Electronics and Information Technology
content.beneficiary: Meritorious students of Scheduled Castes, Backward Classes, Nomadic, DNTs, Semi-Nomadic, Vimukt Jaati and Tapriwas Jaati
content.details: The Haryana government has prepared a scheme to provide scholarship to the meritorious students of Scheduled Castes, Backward Classes, Nomadic, DNTs, Semi-Nomadic, Vimukt Jaati and Tapriwas Jaati of classes 11th to postgraduate level. It aims to produce a feeling of competition amongst them so that they can achieve great milestones in the field of education. Both online and offline applications are invited under this scheme. Under this scheme an incentive from 8000 to 12000 per annum is provided to the meritorious students of classes from class 11th to post graduate level.
benefits: For Students of Backward Classes, Scheduled Castes, Nomadic, DNTs, Semi-Nomadic, Vimukt Jati, and Tapriwas Jaati, scholarship ranging from Rs. 8000/- to 12000/- is awarded for Metric/10th, 10+ and Graduation.
For Students of Backward Classes Block ‘A’, scholarship of amount Rs 8000 is awarded for metric qualified students.
For Students of Backward Classes Block ‘B’, scholarship of amount Rs 8000 is awarded for metric qualified students.
For Meritorious students of other social classes to be given scholarship at par with Students of Backward Classes Block ‘B’, scholarship of amount Rs 8000 is awarded for metric qualified students.
eligibility: For Students of Backward Classes, Scheduled Castes, Nomadic, DNTs, Semi-Nomadic, Vimukt Jati, and Tapriwas Jaati - matric-(Urban 70%) (Rural 60%), 10+2-(Urban 75%) (Rural 70%), Graduation-(Urban 65%) (Rural 60%)
For Students of Backward Classes Block ‘A’ - Metric-(Urban 70%) (Rural 60%)
For Students of Backward Classes Block ‘B’ - Metric-(Urban 80%) (Rural 75%)
For Meritorious students of other social classes to be given scholarship at par with Students of Backward Classes Block ‘B’ - Metric-(Urban 80%) (Rural 75%)
content.application_process: Both online and offline applications are invited. To apply online, visit the Saral Haryana website and register. For offline applications, download the form from the official website, fill it, and submit it to the concerned department.
documents_required: Academic Marksheet of the qualifying exam

faqs.question: How to Apply Online for Dr Ambedkar Medhavi Chattar Sansodhit Yojna?
faqs.answer: To apply online for this scheme, you will have to register yourself by visiting the Saral Haryana website.

faqs.question: Who all are included/considered for this Scheme?
faqs.answer: Students of Backward Classes, Scheduled Castes, Nomadic, DNTs, Semi-Nomadic, Vimukt Jati, and Tapriwas Jati are included in this scheme.

faqs.question: How much scholarship is awarded under this scheme?
faqs.answer: The scholarship provided under this scheme ranges from 8000 to 12000 per annum depending on the percentage of marks obtained and in which class.

faqs.question: How to check the status of the Application?
faqs.answer: Visit the saral Haryana portal and select the track application/appeal option, select the department/service option, enter the application ID and click on check status.

faqs.question: Whom to contact for any issue or further assistance?
faqs.answer: For any issue/information, please contact on helpline number 0172-2566219, 2567009 and district welfare officer of the associated district.

faqs.question: Can I Apply offline for the Scholarship?
faqs.answer: Yes, you need to visit the official website and download the form, fill it and attach the required documents and submit it to the concerned department.

faqs.question: Can student from all states apply for this scheme?
faqs.answer: No, students who have the domicile of Haryana can apply for this scheme.

faqs.question: How do I know if a field in the application form is mandatory?
faqs.answer: The mandatory fields have a red asterisk (*) mark at the end.

faqs.question: How is the incentive amount received?
faqs.answer: Payment is made directly in the bank account of the student.
